pages.content:
Today| is Pigeon's| first day| at school,| she's really| nervous.|
Looking at| the little| daughter| wearing| her backpack,| her mom| encourages her:| “Try| your best,| my darling!| There'll be| a lot| of fun| at school!”
Pigeon| flies over| golden| ripening| rice fields.
Seeing Mr.Buffalo| and his son| deliberately| eating grass| in the distance,| she promptly| waves:| “Good morning| Mr.Buffalo,| I'm heading| to school!”
Pigeon| flies across| a road| filled| with conch| trees| shedding| leaves.| Woah!| What a| beautiful| sight!
She happily| glides| in the air,| chasing| the fawn| leaves| falling| quickly.

Pigeon| rests on| a tree| next to| the market.| She passionately| looks at| the green| sticky rice| wrapped in| lotus leaves| that are| being sold| by old| and young| ladies.|
The green| sticky rice| is really| sticky| and aromatic,| it must be| very| delicious!
Engrossed in| looking at| everything,| Pigeon| loses| track of| time| and forgets| to go| to school.| She's| about to| burst into| tears.

Suddenly,| Sparrow| flies closer| and timidly| suggests:| “Hi,| are you| also heading| to Flying| School?| Let's go| together!| Today| is also| my first| day."|
Pigeon| cheerfully| accepts| the offer,| she's very| happy.| She has| made her| first friend!
Pigeon| and Sparrow| excitedly| show| each other| the puffy| white clouds,| the deep| blue sky| above,| and the gentle| honey| yellow| sunlight| of autumn.

The two| friends| finally| arrive at| the gate| of Flying| School.|
Looking at| all the fire| red flags| fluttering,| the bunches| of colorful| balloons| floating| everywhere,| Pigeon| exclaims:| “Woah,| our school| is so| beautiful!”

Arriving home| in the| evening,| Pigeon| enthusiastically| tells her| parents| about| her adorable| friend| - Sparrow,| about| the beautiful| colors| of autumn| that she| encountered| on her way| to school...

All of| a sudden,| Pigeon| exclaims:| "Mom,| the Moon| is so| bright| tonight!"|
Her mother| gently| smiles,| hugging| Pigeon| in her arms:| "Tonight| is Mid-Autumn| Festival| - the family| reunion day,| the day| when| the Moon| is the brightest| in the| year!"
Pigeon| joyfully| looks at| the brilliant| moonlight| above| and the| colorful| lanterns| of the children| parading| below.
"Mommy,| allow me| to join| the lantern| parade| with my| fellows!"
